titleproper.value: Guide to the Brooklyn Air Disaster scrapbook <num>2018.007</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-09-11T15:06:21</date>

abstract.value: This collection includes on scrapbook of newspaper clippings pertaining to the 1960 air plane collision and subsequent crash in Park Slope. Newspapers represented in the scrapbook include the <emph render="italic">New York Post</emph>, the <emph render="italic">World-Telegram</emph>, the <emph render="italic">New York Times</emph>, the <emph render="italic">Herald-Tribune</emph>, the <emph render="italic">Daily Mirror</emph> and others. Coverage dates from December 16, 1960 through September 1963.

p.value: This collection is open for research.
Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn Air Disaster scrapbook, 2018.007, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
The scrapbook was found in the repository, and its provenance is unknown. The item was found with the box number Fol.Bklyn.Scr165 and was assigned a 2018 accession number.

On December 16, 1960, 
Flight paths of the two aircraft involved, a United Airlines flight bound for Idlewild Airport (now John F. Kennedy International Airport) collided with a TWA flight descending into the city's LaGuardia Airport. One plane crashed on Staten Island, the other into Park Slope at the intersection of Seventh Avenue and Sterling Place. All 128 people on both aircraft were killed and six people on the ground. The accident became known also as the Park Slope plane crash and on Staten Island, it became known as the Miller Field crash.

This collection consists of one scrapbook of newspaper clippings pertaining to the 1960 air plane collision and subsequent crash in Park Slope. Newspapers represented in the scrapbook include the <emph render="italic">New York Post</emph>, the <emph render="italic">World-Telegram</emph>, the <emph render="italic">New York Times</emph>, the <emph render="italic">Herald-Tribune</emph>, the <emph render="italic">Daily Mirror</emph> and others. Coverage dates from December 16, 1960 through September 1963.
